title: API Docs: net

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: E-help-wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue.

labels.name: E-medium
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Medium / intermediate

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

body:
Part of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29329

http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/


Here's what needs to be done to close out this issue: 

- [ ] [the module documentation](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/) is very tiny and needs expanded.
- [ ] [`ParseError`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.AddrParseError.html) needs to link to where it comes from and have examples.
- [ ] [`Incoming`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.Incoming.html) should use the standard iterator boilerplate and move its semantics into the method docs.
- [ ] [`Ipv4Addr`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.Ipv4Addr.html) needs better top-level docs and should link to `IpAddr`
- [ ] many places in these docs should say "IETF RFC" rather than "RFC", as we have Rust RFCs as well.
- [ ] [`Ipv6Addr`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.Ipv6Addr.html) same as `Ipv4Addr`.
- [ ] [`SocketAddrV4`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.SocketAddrV4.html) has poor top-level docs and needs to have a defined summary/explanation split. Its methods are okay, but very short. It needs to link to `SocketAddr`.
- [ ] [`SocketAddrV6`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.SocketAddrV6.html) same
- [ ] [`TcpListener`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.TcpListener.html)'s docs don't really say what it is.
- [ ] [`TcpStream`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.TcpStream.html)'s the same.
- [ ] [`UpdSocket`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/struct.UdpSocket.html) is the same.
- [ ] [`IpAddr`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/enum.IpAddr.html) should link to an IETF RFC
- [ ] [`Shutdown`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/enum.Shutdown.html) should use the standard boilerplate 
- [ ] [`SocketAddr`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/enum.SocketAddr.html) has very short docs.
- [ ] [`ToSocketAddrs`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/net/trait.ToSocketAddrs.html) needs a lot of links.
